intro: Cissampelos mauritiana, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically orange or red when ripe. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions make it a popular choice for horticultural use.
